author: Staff Reporter
text:
A special cell for ‘job fraud prevention’ established by the district police to safeguard gullible job seekers and investors warned the public against a fraudster through e-mail here on Monday.

Sources in the cell said that a fraudster had sent an e-mail/sms to the public inviting them to give personal details, including bank accounts etc.

The e-mail goes like this: “Due to death of my husband I decided to donate my fund to you for charity work to help poor orphanage in your country in India, if interested contact me over my mail mrsdareaddymg@gmail.com.”

The special cell appealed to the public not to respond to these kinds of e-mail/sms, the sources said.
title: “Beware of online fraudster”
